ygData.subject: Re: Problem with Creating Jobs based on Profile with Overrides.
ygData.msgSnippet: I tried to repeat the same thing with latest code from the CVS. The version I am using is heritrix-1.3.0-200503111137 and I can reproduce the issue. Based on

I tried to repeat the same thing with latest code from the CVS. The
version I am using is heritrix-1.3.0-200503111137 and I can reproduce
the issue. 

Based on your suggestion, I checked the xml under the
NEW_PROFILE/settings.xml using xmllint and the XML seems to be well
formed. And then I renamed my settings directory to settings1 and I
was able to create a job based on the new profile. I believe then
there is something wrong with the settings directory content. The
generated settings.xml for the new profile is below.

****************************************
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<crawl-settings xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="heritrix_settings.xsd">
  <meta>
    <name/>
    <description/>
    <operator>Admin</operator>
    <organization/>
    <audience/>
    <date>20050315044456</date>
  </meta>
  <object name="scope">
    <integer name="max-link-hops">3</integer>
    <integer name="max-trans-hops">2</integer>
  </object>
</crawl-settings>
****************************************
let me know if you find the problem.

Many Thanks

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> ranjeetbhatia1976 wrote:
> 
> >
> > Hi all, I have edited the simple profile by adding overrides for a
> > particular domain. In the override I just modified certain scope
> > parameters such as I reduced max-hop-links from the default value of 5
> > to 4. I save the profile - no problems.
> >
> > But as soon as I try to create a new job based on this profile I get
> > the following error. I am using version 1.2.0 and interacting with
> > application only with the WUI. Any help will be greatly
> > appriciated....
> 
> You might check the files under YOUR_NEW_PROFILE/settings -- the 
> location under which snippets of xml that represent the override are 
> ketp -- with something like xmllint to ensure the xml snippets written 
> to disk by Heritrix were well-formed.  In the past we've written bad
xml 
> and this may be your issue. You could also try moving aside the 
> 'setting's directory that is under your new profile and see if then new 
> jobs can be created successfully from your new profile -- this will at 
> least isolate the problem as something to do w/ settings directory
content.
> 
> St.Ack
> 
> >
> > Many thanks.
